ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Does anyone solo anymore?
ygData.msgSnippet: Su, Look into a prograM called Norton s Ghost.  It will do exactly what you want it to do.  I ve used it several times on my own systems when installing new
ygData.messageBody:
Su,
 
Look into a prograM called Norton's Ghost.  It will do exactly what you want it to do.  I've used it several times on my own systems when installing new hard drives to set as primary.  Basically, what you do is install the new drive as a slave, completely wiped (you dont even have to partition it).  Then you install Norton's Ghost on your main drive.  Run Norton's Ghost and choose the option to do a direct ghost copy to the new drive.  Everything right down to the partitions will be copied to the new drive.  Then you shut down the machine, switch the drive over to master and reboot.  Barring any major problems it'll boot up exactly as if it were the regular drive on that system.  Then you can take the original drive and wipe it and use it as a secondary for extra space.  It's a handy program.
 
Your system sounds decent enough to run EQ albeit with some lag in the newer zones.  Turning off a lot of options might help that though.  However, on DirecWay I wouldn't expect too much.  DirecWay is bad about limiting the amount of data that can be sent at any given time.  If you send mroe than you are allowed to, they pretty much stop all communication and give you some stupid message about exceedxing the bandwidth.  Then it takes like 5 minutes to reset.  You can look it up, the info is right there ont he DirecWay site.  That's why they don't reccomend using DirecWay for gaming.  But if all you want to do is browse the web and chat, it's fine.  If I can find the link, I'll post it for you.
 
Wulfric
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Su Johnston
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, April 23, 2006 6:42 AM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Does anyone solo anymore?

I have a Cleric. But I haven't actually gotten xp in
over a year. I can't even get dialup where I live
because the phone company has spliced my lines so
badly I can't even dial out to an ISP. They refuse to
fix it and so far I haven't found any way to get them
to. Too much other stuff to worry about frankly. Like
finding a lawyer to sue a doctor for malpractice, and
still working on repairing hurricane Rita damage.
I currently have direcway Satellite-- which inherently
has latency. When I first got it with the Direcway
4000 2-way the bandwidth was 800k down and about 50k
up (allegedly 50k up-- clocked around 30k). Sometime
later when the modem died due to an incident with my
cat and a glass of milk I got the newer Direcway 6000.
Direcway then dropped the bandwidth to 500k down
(without informing me). When I play world of warcraft
I generally have between 1200 to 4000ms latency. Last
time I tried to get into EQ it just kept timing out on
me.
As for my system, I have an AMD athlon thunderbird
1.4Ghz processor, 1GB of DDR SDRAM, ASUS A7M266-M
motherboard, GeForce 4 Ti 4600 128Mb vid card, and
Philips Acoustic Edge 5.1 sound card.
I plan on upgrading to an ASUS A8V Deluxe (rev 2)
motherboard, 2Gb Kingston PC3200 ValueRAM, and AMD
Athlon 3500 2.0GHz processor (with venice core).
I will be using my same video card, sound card, and
power supply (Antec SmartPower 2.0 450W) and adding an
additional 300Gb harddrive.
I'm currently trying to figure out how to transfer all
of my data from my puny primary drive and putting it
on the 300Gb drive and setting it as primary, then
upgrading to the new mobo setup without having to use
a windows xp cd. Unfortunately I don't have restore
CDs for my pc bc it didn't come with any software on
CDs. One of those deals where HP partitioned the
harddrive. Since the warrenty is up on it I doubt I
could get tech support from them.
I wish I could figure out a way to just copy all of
the programs so that they would be installable. I
should have an extra OEM of xp laying around somewhere
but it got lost in all the chaos of the hurricane.
luv,
-Su


--- Wulfric Rennison <wulftech@...> wrote:


---------------------------------
Su> what class are you?  And what is your connection
speed?  I assume you're on dial up in a rural area and
highs peed internet such as cable or DSL is not
available to you.  Even if you're connecting at
44k-46k sometimes you can help yourself by what kind
of computer you have.  I know at one point I had a
PIII 800mhz system on an ISDN line and I didn't have
TOO much lag.  But that was back when Kunark and
Velious were the newest expansions.  Now I have a P4
2.4 Ghz with 1GB RAM and a 256MB video card on a 5Mb
cable modem connection.  No lag at all.


Wulfric


-----Original Message-----
From: Su Johnston
Sent: Apr 18, 2006 12:28 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Does anyone solo anymore?

I prefer to solo, unfortunately its not possible with
my connection. At level 66 I still have trouble
killing level 30s. Mostly because of the damage
misreporting related to the lag. Although I haven't
played in months. My connection has gotten so bad that
I really can't play anymore. I tried doing an LDON a
few months ago but the lag got so bad that I was stuck
for 15 minutes unable to do anything. Zoning takes at
least 5 minutes. If I die it will take me 20 minutes
at the very least to get back to my corpse. Sometimes
an hour if I have to zone a lot.
I really don't think the game is designed for
characters of my class and level to be able to solo.
I've pretty much switched to World of Warcraft now
because it doesn't do damage misreporting and death
doesn't take too much time.
luv,
-Su

--- Just Me <eeyore_95682@...> wrote:

> After a year and a half of playing, I've done a lot
> of group play and
> a lot of duoing, but I seem to enjoy soloing more
> nowdays.  I can go
> where I want, do what I want and keep the loot and
> xp for myself.
> Don't get me wrong, I still like to group, but
> sometimes, for my own
> peace of mind, I much prefer soloing.  Anyone else?
>
>
>
>
